intro: Dolicholus pyramidalis, commonly known as the pyramid leaf orchid, is a unique orchid species native to Madagascar. It is characterized by its elongated, sword-shaped leaves that form a dense rosette, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces intricate, fragrant flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color, with a complex structure typical of orchids. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
